topic: LightStanza: 2 free talks in San Francisco June 25 and June 26th
body:
Dear Radiance Colleagues,


I will be giving two FREE talks on daylighting at the Pacific Energy Center
in San Francisco this month.  On June 25, I will be presenting an evening
lecture on the current annual metrics, discussing their strengths,
limitations, assumptions and controversies, including their applications in
the new LEED v4.  This lecture will also be simulcast online.  On June 26,
I will be giving a hands-on training workshop on LightStanza, our new
Web-Application for Radiance-based daylight simulation and analysis.  An
overview video of this software is at:


https://youtu.be/ju6hn3FyIz4


Registration links (which include longer descriptions and detailed agendas)
for both events are listed below.  I hope you can join me!


Daylight Deconstructed: A Visual Understanding of Sustainability Metrics
and How to Apply Them


Thursday June 25, 2015


6:30pm - 8:00pm


AIA 1.5 LU/HSW Hours


Register:
https://pge-web.ungerboeck.com/classcalendar/Details.aspx?OrgCode=10&EventId=11648


or to join the online simulcast, register:
http://lightstanza.com/GTMregistrationform.html


Streamlining Daylight Analysis In The Cloud


Friday June 26, 2015


9:00am - 3:00pm


Register: http://lightstanza.com/registerform.html


Thanks,


Dan






Daniel C. Glaser, PhD, LEED AP BD+C, IESPrincipal
